channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pathway obstruction, 14th February
item.description:
The pathway is completely blocked from overhanging vegetation. This is right on a bend at the roundabout opposite summerton way. You have to walk in the road just to pass, but as it’s a bend you can’t see if traffic is oncoming. This is an accident waiting to happen

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Cat, 14th February
item.description:
There is a dead cat in the curb. Not sure who was the best people to contact
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Hill Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fountain House bin store, 14th February
item.description:
The bin store is absolutely filthy. Every time they empty the bins the bin men drop rubbish all over the floor and do not pick up rubbish that has fallen out of the bins which until recently were overflowing because they have missed several recycling collections.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned recycling bin, 14th February
item.description:
Abandoned recycling bin on Bermondsey Wall East next to fountain green square being used by moronic dog walkers to bin dog waste. Was overflowing this morning and people still putting waste on top

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old bottles and cans in flower bed, 14th February
item.description:
There have been of bottles and cans in here next to fountsin house bin store. They've been there for months and one appears to have urine in it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on planters on Tabard Street, 14th February
item.description:
There are cans, food packaging, paper and bottles on the planters located Tabard Street. It has been there for four days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-52, Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-52, Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping, 14th February
item.description:
Someone has fly tipped some household items outside our building. They've been here for a few days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gloucester Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of litter beside the William Camden Pub, 14th February
item.description:
Lots of litter down the side road and next to Hamilton car garage in Avenue Road not been picked up. William Camden pub produces lots of litter outside its premises glass etc snd down the side road next to the pub especially at weekends. This road leads into the Council car park for railway station. I drove by this morning and the litter at the end of Avenue Road into Broadway next to derelict phone box still hadn’t been picked up as yet? I think I will let Baroness ONeil know as this has been reported 5 times now over a month!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked, 14th February
item.description:
Drain blocked from tree debris. Continual problem sending excess water running down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silverdale Road, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken and LOOSE paving slabs and a step. They move a lot when you step on them snd are DANGEROUS. Someone is going to get a nasty injury., 14th February
item.description:
See above dangerous paving & step that move significantly when you tread on them. Someone will get injured.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmfield Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown/blocked footpath Ponders End to Athletics Centre, 14th February
item.description:
The pedestrian route from Ponders End rail station to Lee Valley athletics centre is inaccessible for a large proportion of the route owing to overgrown brambles, tree and hedge. It is necessary to walk on the separate cycle path. This is dangerous and an accessibility issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meridian Way, Ponders End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Aggressive dog without leash on the children playground, 14th February
item.description:
In the children playground a dog was running free and chasing children. My own were horrified as they do not have a good experience with dogs (a dog jumped on them). The owner refused to remove the dog. Can this be urgently looked at as it is really unsafe to allow a dog running like this in the children playground? My daughter thinks the child is in year 3 in Primary Southborough School and attends Garden club after school club.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Oaks, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grafitti, 14th February
item.description:
As above

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sinking, 14th February
item.description:
This has been here over a year and now has got significantly worse road is sinking on the roundabout coming out of yarton way almost across the roundabout from one side to the other soon cars will get damaged in the dark
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harrow Manorway, Abbey Wood

item.title: Large Pothole Growing on Canterbury Grove, 14th February
item.description:
Nasty, deep pothole on a busy tributary road used by the 315 bus. Dangerous for cyclists and motorcycles and causes cars to move over the central white line to avoid it. Dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canterbury Grove, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Play Area, 14th February
item.description:
This play area is in desperate need of TLC! The floor is covered in green moss, the AstroTurf is coming up and has big holes in it, which a child fell over today! There is vile graffiti over the children's climbing frames etc, and lots of it needs repairing. It used to be a lovely place to go and is now very run down and needs repairing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray Road, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dis-guarded Needles, 14th February
item.description:
Approximately 5 dis-guarded needles were found in the telephone box outside of Mornington Crescent Station and require safe disposal

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead Road, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
